pages.text: This kettle has been a life-saver. Among my favourite brews are $(l:cooking/exotic_fruits)green teas$(/l), which have really helped ease my withering and I recover health far quicker. It brings me $(l)vitality$().$(br2)$(l:cooking/exotic_fruits)Yellow teas$(/l) fortify me with $(l)tenacity$(), making me sturdier and more resilient.

pages.title: Effects
pages.text: $(l:cooking/exotic_fruits)Black tea$(/l) brings me a greater sense of $(l)maturity$(), I won't lie. It pairs well with foods, and—honestly—not even foul foods bother me when I've got a cup.$(br2)By far my favourite has to be $(l:cooking/exotic_fruits)coffee$(/l). The $(l)caffeinated$() state makes me more responsive, and I can stay up forever without going insane! I've never encountered any of those nightmarish phantoms with a cup of coffee in me.

pages.title: Experimentation
pages.text: Even better is when I combine tea leaves and coffee beans with mint, adzuki beans, vanilla, and chocolate. It adds even more to the effects.$(br2)Hell, even dandelions and rose hips make for good teas. They ease my pains. I've even gambled with raw coffee berries and glow berries to mixed success.
It's important you fill it up with a few water bottle before the brew, unless you like the taste of charred, dry leaves.
